summary: Art Nouveau was an art and design style popular from 1890 to 1910. It focused on natural shapes like plants and flowers, using curved lines and modern materials like iron and glass. The style aimed to bridge the gap between fine and applied arts. It started in Brussels, Belgium, and spread across Europe, influencing architecture, furniture, and art. Known for its decorative beauty, Art Nouveau was later replaced by Art Deco and Modernism.
title: Art Nouveau
